<@360491619402776577> A doubt about eth/68 definition in https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5793, the sizes are defined as `B_4` but shouldn't they be `P` ? It seems that geth implements it as scalar int, and Besu is getting disconnected with this error `invalid message: message msg #8 (157028 bytes): invalid message: (code 8) (size 157028) rlp: non-canonical integer (leading zero bytes) for uint32, decoding into (eth.NewPooledTransactionHashesPacket68).Sizes[0]` 
I think it makes sense to use scalar int so checking if the EIP needs an update.
